name: caulk
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also caulking) a substance used for filling in the spaces around the edge of something, for example a bath or window frame : Seal the gaps around the pipes with an expanding foam caulk.
More examplesFewer examplesI bought a tube of caulk.He rolled a piece of caulk between his fingers.The caulk matches the colour of the stone.

to fill the spaces around the edge of something, for example a bath or window frame, with a special substance: Weatherstrip and caulk doors and windows to save energy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe holes in the roof were sealed temporarily with plywood and caulked.The company caulked around the plugs to prevent leakage.Latex produced by this plant was used for caulking boats.
